results.title: Friends and foes
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
There are major biotic factors which affect plant growth including the impact of pests and diseases and the competition with other plants for light and resources. Highlighted are some of the techniques developed to control these problems and the beneficial relationships which exist between plants and living organisms. A contemporary approach known as Integrated Pest Management looks at various methods used to control pests and disease while minimising environmental impact.

results.title: Friends and Enemies
results.brief_description: This is a provocative film about one of the most vicious and protracted labour disputes in Australian history. In February 1985, over one thousand electrical workers went on strike against the introduction of contractors into the South East Queensland Electricity Board. Rated: PG

results.title: Friends
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Peter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: Looks at the concept of friendship. The story involves three girls - one, a possessive girl, another with an extroverted nature and the third who is seen by the first girl to threaten the friendship. The film is open-ended and relates to the social studies theme of “cultural influences”. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Friendly Fiji
results.brief_description: Fiji, one time home of warring tribes, is now a peace loving island with a thriving tourist trade. Palm beaches, ocean waters, traditional native ceremonies, and the cosmopolitan capital of Suva are among the many attractions. Outlines Fiji’s history from the first missionaries, to British Dependency in 1874, and the present government. Shows the ceremonial opening of the Legislative Council, soldiers in parade dres, and the official raising of the flag.

results.title: Friend or Foe (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An award-winning adaptation of the book by Michael Morpurgo, this is the story of two London boys evacuated to the British countryside during World War 11. Unaccustomed to the countryside, one boy falls into a fast flowing stream and is rescued by a stranded German pilot. Although the Germans are the enemy one has saved David’s life, so the boys, in turn, help the pilot and his wounded companion.

results.title: Friend or foe
results.creator_credit: Gordon L.T. Scott, Children's Film Foundation and John Krish
results.brief_description: A children’s feature set in Britain during World War 2 that focuses on the experiences of two London boys sent to board with a farming family during the period of heavy bombing. On one particular day the pilot from a ditched German bomber saves one boy from drowning and the boys must then decide whether or not to tell the English authorities of the German’s whereabouts. This film is useful for discussion about the sense of war, concepts of right and wrong, the nature of friendship and loyalty, peer group pressure and family relationships. Based on the novel by Michael Morpugo, script by John Krish.

results.title: Friend of sinners
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus of Nazareth from: the shame of Mary Magdalene; the Rich Young Man approaches Jesus; the miracle of the loaves and the fishes; Zealots and Judas discuss the work of Jesus; Simon the Zealot follows Jesus; in the house of Simon the Pharisee; Joseph of Arimathea converses with Jesus; Mary Magdelene washes Jesus’ feet with her hair, Jesus forgives her sins.

results.title: Friend and foe
results.creator_credit: Antony Barrier, Antony Barrier Productions and Philip Owtram
results.brief_description: Intended for dog handlers, the film shows how to reach a perfect understanding with a particular dog by developing its latent natural instincts, yet obeying every command.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Rank Organisation Film Productions, ACT III Communications, Electric Shadow Productions, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions and Jon Avnet
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports Evelyn back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to separate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.
